posts.author: Demos
posts.content: I would drop Power Attack and Cleave to fit in Still Spell (or Craft Wand) and Knockdown. Also, I would go with longsword (which ypu can Keen) over spear to grab the extra AC from carrying a shield.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Demos wrote:I would drop Power Attack and Cleave to fit in Still Spell (or Craft Wand) and Knockdown. Also, I would go with longsword (which ypu can Keen) over spear to grab the extra AC from carrying a shield.
Longsword FTW, definitely, this guy is already an AC specialist, with PM 16, Draconic Armor and Bard Song, his AC is off the charts!Add a shield to that and it goes evenb further! Sadly, at the cost of AB and ending up with 3 base APR. Oh well, you can't have it all

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I agree that longsword is a good idea, but I like Cleave too much to give it up.

posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:Here's the new-and-improved version:
Abilities:
STR: 14 (28)
DEX: 12
CON: 14 (22)
WIS: 8
INT: 14 (16)
CHA: 14 (16)
Why charisma 16? You can only cast up to level 5 spells, and looking at those the best one there seems to be greater dispelling. I would give up level 5 casting and one level 3 use per day (resulting from starting charisma two lower), and start one strength higher and grab epic prowess.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: According the the CBC, there are are also 4 castings but no spells known at level 6. Those could be used for extended level 5 spells. It would make more sense to me to do what you said, "start one strength higher and grab epic prowess", except reduce INT by 2 instead of CHA, returning skills to what they were in the original version, except 3 more Perform and 3 less Lore.

posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:According the the CBC, there are are also 4 castings but no spells known at level 6. Those could be used for extended level 5 spells. It would make more sense to me to do what you said, "start one strength higher and grab epic prowess", except reduce INT by 2 instead of CHA, returning skills to what they were in the original version, except 3 more Perform and 3 less Lore.
''

At bard 14 you cannot cast any level 6 spells, but have one casting of a level 5 spell.

While reducing int may also do it, though less preferable, you could go half-elf, I don't see why you are choosing a race that has a penalty to constitution yet strives for constitution feats and does not really use the dex bonus for anything.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I deliberately chose to make an Elf tank to go against type.
Maybe the level 6 slots are there because of all those Pale Master levels.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:
Maybe the level 6 slots are there because of all those Pale Master levels.
Of course they are. You have the full spell slots in fact.

posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content:
KailPendragon wrote:
Empyre65 wrote:
Maybe the level 6 slots are there because of all those Pale Master levels.
Of course they are. You have the full spell slots in fact.
Right, missed pm. So 15 charisma is worth it. As for 6th level spells, I don't see much 5th level that would be useful for extending. Perhaps, ethereal visage, but improved invisibility gives higher concealment, and low level spells are not usually something worth worrying about.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: It dawns on me that longsword-and-shield is out because there is no shield proficiency. It could still be done with a lot of shuffling. To do it, I would have to drop Curse Song, take Shield Proficiency at level 3, and bump the rest of the pre-epic feats 3 levels later each.

posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:It dawns on me that longsword-and-shield is out because there is no shield proficiency. It could still be done with a lot of shuffling. To do it, I would have to drop Curse Song, take Shield Proficiency at level 3, and bump the rest of the pre-epic feats 3 levels later each.
Bards are proficient with shields.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Oops! I should have looked it up in the wiki. Then longsword-and-shield is the way to go, unless you want the 1.5 STR damage bonus from wielding a spear with 2 hands. I'd opt for the AC of a shield. I have corrected it in the first post.
